ygData.subject: Re: Skull of Jhen'Tra Information
ygData.msgSnippet: Gnoll Embalmers are what drops the Skull of Jhen Tra.  I have always gotten a Skull from one, but I have heard stories where this may not be the case. They are
ygData.messageBody:
Gnoll Embalmers are what drops the Skull of Jhen'Tra. I have always gotten
a Skull from one, but I have heard stories where this may not be the case.

They are a level 20 mob from memory, they only seem to appear at Dusk or
Dawn, basically when the undead appears or disappears from the spawn
locations.

The spawn at same locations as the Gnoll High Shamans and if you are not
high enough level so that the other Gnolls are green, they will join in.
Try and con all nearby gnolls before you attack, or even better get yourself
a group.

When the Embalmers appear, if you can attack one early enough it will not
have enough time to summon its pet.

Please be warned they are Necromancers and they can cast some nasty spells,
DOTs and Fear.

The Embalmers also drop a plus 10 mana hoop, Crysknife plus other
miscellaneous items on occasion.

The Skull is a lore item, so you can only really obtain one at a time.
----- Original Message -----
From: Ezhar Montenegro <Ezhar@...>
To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 21, 1999 10:16 AM
Subject: [EQ-Monks] Skull of Jhen'Tra Information


> From: "Ezhar Montenegro" <Ezhar@...>
>
> Brothers and Sisters,
>
> As part of the Purple Headband quest, I recently was able to acquire
Zaharn's Coronet from within Permafrost. I've been holding the Dagger of
Marnek for some time now, just waiting for the day when I could obtain the
coronet (it being the hardest item of the 3 to get). Now I am left with
needing the final component, the Skull of Jhen'Tra. At first I auctioned
for one, not sure if I had the energy to adventure to a strange land and
attempt to find it. But now I think that I shall!
>
> Does anyone have any tips on this mob (Which Gnoll Embalmer? Level
needed?) and it's resident zone (Lake Rathe?).
>
> Any information would be greatly appreciated.
>
>
>

> Ezhar Montenegro
